data.title: Hmm lets see
data.text: It was great the food was great n so were the people.. It's located in a great place right next to the courthouse square.

data.title: Great Lunch and Breakfast
data.text: Was on Jury duty so didn't have a lot of time for lunch. Walked to this place at lunch from the courthouse and was surprised on how big the place was inside. The food ordered was great and we didn't have a long wait either. I tried Breakfast one day also and again the food was great. The only downfall is parking and I don't believe they served dinner. But they cater I guess mostly to the downtown area.

data.title: Not so good
data.text:
After reading about this place on a blog, a friend and I decided to check it out. Upon entering, I was leery. The ceilings are low and it was quite dark. There was a small counter in the corner where it looked like the kitchen was. 

The servers were slow and took a while to get our drinks. The menu was small and consisted mainly of sandwiches. The food took a while to arrive and it was very bland. I definitely will not be back.

data.title: Ignored
data.text: My husband and I have not dined here recently though in the past we were regulars both for lunch and their occasional soirees.  We seated ourselves and were ignored for an extended period by the waitress "visiting" with the diners at the adjacent table.  She eventually acknowledged our presence and said our "waitress would be with us shortly." The other waitress was dealing with a large group of about 15.  Eventually she was free and served drinks and took our order.  My husband had the breakfast buffet and although the quality of the food was good,  it had been on the line for an extended period and was now cold.  I ordered from the kitchen which arrived minus the potatoes,  they were delivered after I had finished my meal and were cold since they too came from the buffet.  The waitress holding court at the next table continued her loud conversation from which we learned she is the new owner, Lucille,  and has big plans for the place.  We will not be returning and am sure that Renee would not have tolerated such poor treatment of her customers.  Renee should not have her reputation sullied in such a manner.  We have been customers there since the cafe was first opened.

data.title: Quiet and enjoyable
data.text: Our first lunch visit and we will be back. Their Reuben was one of the best and hand cut fries excellent. Home made "guilty verdict" (home made apple pie with streusel topping and vanilla bean ice cream) was delicious.

owner_response.author: NeeNeech, Owner at Courthouse Caffe, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for coming in and taking the time to write a review for us. It is greatly appreciated and in this day and age quite necessary. Please come againg and ask for Renee so I can say Hello.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Nice
data.text: Very good food..A great variety to choose from..The staff were very nice..would definitely eat there again.

owner_response.author: NeeNeech, Owner at Courthouse Caffe, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for the kind review. One thing to tell you is that we like to thank our guests who take the time to post online with a free cup of soup next time you come in. Just print out the review or show it to us on your mobile device when it is 30 days or less old. Once again THANK YOU!!!!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: BEST place in town for lunch!
data.text: We came into town to meet up with family for my mother's funeral.  We wanted a place to meet and sit and visit over a meal after the service, so I called Renee's Courthouse Caffe'.  They were wonderful from the get-go.  They were kind, accommodating, and efficient.  The food was fabulous- fresh with a great variety to choose from!  The staff was solicitous and thoughtful.  All in all a wonderful experience on a very sad day.  I would eat there all the time if we lived closer!

data.title: Local professional clientele
data.text:
Very nice facility in a a unique location that draws in local professionals.  My first visit was for a light lunch with a friend.  Atmosphere was very pleasant and inviting. Very engaging,friendly service.  Staff worked very well as a team to make my visit a memorable one.  I had a bowl of Vermont Cheddar soup, it had lil chunks of apple in it.  very good though unexpected.  I would recommend it!
 I have lived here for 25 years, drove by here many times…..Should have stopped earlier.
Special hour out to my waitress Jessie!  A real sweetheart!

data.title: Waited at least 45 minutes for our lunch
data.text: Today was my first visit here after living in Jacksonville for many years now.  Our waiter was great, but they obviously needed more employees today.  Our order was only a burger, salad, and pb and j sandwich.  From the time we walked in to when we were served lunch was over 45 mins.  I want to try it again, because our food was good quality with a fair price.  I will follow up with a more positive review, if service improves.

owner_response.author: NeeNeech, Owner at Courthouse Caffe, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Ms Irene,

So sorry to hear that you waited so long for your lunch. I agree that is too long. I do hope you will come again and that we can make it up to you. I am glad that at least the waiter was able to make the front of the house experience good for you.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Don't miss their brunches!
data.text: If you are in Jacksonville for one of the holidays that Renee's does a brunch for, DON'T MISS IT! Make sure you have her award wining Apple Pie.  My favorite soup is the Tomato Chicken or Cream of Mushroom.

owner_response.author: NeeNeech, Owner at Courthouse Caffe, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for the kind words. Hope to see you again real soon!!!!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Best Dinner
data.text: Renee is known for having great lunch and catering but I think many people still don't know about the dinner service.  We love to go for dinner because the food is good, it is not too noisy, like many other places.  Currently they are only open the 1st 2 Fridays each month, maybe that will change if word gets out.

owner_response.author: NeeNeech, Owner at Courthouse Caffe, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
So happy you enjoyed yourself for dinner.  We were actually quite busy this past Friday night, (word might buffer getting out)!!
Come again soon.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Fantastic location for breakfast, lunch or a special event!
data.text: The Courthouse Caffe is a terrific, local restaurant, which is refreshing in a town like Jacksonville.  I'm not from the area and was trying to plan a 50th anniversary party for my in-laws and came across the Courthouse Caffe, and I'm so glad I did! In a place that is littered with chain restaurants, the Courthouse is a local establishment with terrific food and charm. The owner, Renee, was fantastic to work with and the room was set up so nicely that it made the entire evening incredibly memorable. We also recently had a family lunch there and Renee made sure we were all taken care of and had everything we needed. We plan on going back again when we are in the area - we highly recommend it!

owner_response.author: NeeNeech, Owner at Courthouse Caffe, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for your praise. Your party was alot of fun and I am glad we were able to help back in July. Everyone certainly did seem to enjoy themselves and your decor was stunning.
I am also so sorry for your recent loss and that you were not able to come down here.
I do however look forward to our paths crossing once again in the summer.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Best kept secret - homemade & gluten free cooking - downtown Jacksonville
data.text: Don't miss the experience of eating at downtown Jacksonville's Courthouse Cafe!  Not being from Jacksonville, I found it while exploring, and don't want to keep it a secret for newcomers.  I tried it for breakfast and was able to get gluten free pancakes, and realized also that they had more gluten free options for lunch and dinner to help with the diet I'm on.  Not only that, but they have ton's of other items on their menu that I plan to check out again soon.

data.title: ladies at  Lunchtime
data.text: Returned for a lunch with a friend and found the same tired menu.  Service is somewhat improved but wait staff unfriendly with no polish whatsoever.  Owner comes out to speak to only some tables.   Food is good but will take out next time.

owner_response.author: NeeNeech, Owner at Courthouse Caffe, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Beth,
I do hope you have returned since our new menu has debuted. We did need to make changes and have finally done so. It is difficult to come up with new menu selections while using the "court theme" around here, but we have done it. Please come back again with the Ladies, and have some new items.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great Food!
data.text: Although I have lived in the area for years I just came across this find. I had heard great thing's from people, but never knew where it was. I finally tried it for lunch and I was amazed! The service and food were great!

data.title: Alright
data.text: Went to this restaurant to have a "non-chain" experience.  It's only open a couple nights per month fyi.  Anyway, it was decent.  I got a chicken plate and it was kind of rubbery; I couldn't finish it because it was creeping me out.  No real reason to go back.  Service was good though.

data.title: Good food, good prices
data.text: I've eaten here a few times with friends, and always have had a good meal.  Mostly lunch fares, interesting specials and great soups.  The owner does catering on the side, and it's fantastic!

data.title: Good food
data.text: Convenient to downtown.  A variety of lunch menu items for those who want something delicious but not heavy on the stomach.  Staff is often stretched right at noon but the food is worth any wait.  Love their wraps.

data.title: Good
data.text: The sandwiches are awsome! the restaurant is like old fashion but the service is fast

data.title: Slowest service in Jacksonville
data.text:
I have been to this restaurant multiple times for lunch over the past few years always hoping that the service would get better because the food is decent and it has a convenient location.  
But the service is always slow.  There can be one table or 15 tables, expect to have to get your waitress’s attention to order food, get refills, get the check, basically for everything you need.
The owner even accused me of trying to get food for free.  I ordered a sandwich without mushrooms and after my second bite discovered a mushroom.  After finally getting the waitress’s attention I asked to get the sandwich remade and then to box it to go since it had taken so long to order and get the food.  They remade the sandwich but only gave me half of it.  When I said that I should have gotten a whole sandwich the owner said that since I had eaten so much of the sandwich before returning it that I would only get half a sandwich.  I had only taken two small bites.
Very unhappy with the service, the restaurant has a history of slow staff and the food is not worth the frustration.
On a positive note, the carrot cilantro soup there is excellent so if they are making it that day it is worth the trip.  Make sure you call ahead and get it to go so you don’t have to wait on the wait staff.

owner_response.author: NeeNeech, Owner at Courthouse Caffe, responded to this review
owner_response.text: I am so glad you have enjoyed our dinners. We try to additionally offer fresh seafood specials each night we are open. Last night we had Blackened Mahi with a Curried Cream Sauce and garnished with Toasted Coconut. We sold out!!! (Word might be getting out about us)
owner_response.title: Owner Response
